name: Alice Zwerling's Recipe Book

text: Serves 4 to 6.

Prepare and microwave cauliflower; microwave at high 5 1/2 - 7 1/2 minutes.  Let stand covered three minutes.  If doing flowerets (2 cups) 4-7 minutes at high in covered dish with 1/4 cup water.  Stir once; let stand, covered, 2-3 minutes.

Combine mushrooms and butter in one quart casserole; microwave at high 1 1/2-2 minutes or until mushrooms are tender, stirring after one minute.  Blend in flour and seasonings.  Stir in milk.  Microwave at high 1 1/2-3 minutes or until thickened, stirring every minute.  Mix in cheese, microwave at high 15 seconds to melt if necessary.  Blend in sour cream, serve over cauliflower.

ingred.name: asparagus, steamed and cut into 3/4" pieces

text: Bring the broth to a simmer in medium saucepan.  Heat the oil in a heavy saucepan over moderately low heat and cook the onion, stirring occasionally until soft, 3-5 minutes.  Add the rice and cook, stirring constantly, one minute.  Add wine and simmer, stirring constantly until absorbed, about one minute.  Add 3/4 cup of hot broth, salt and pepper and simmer, stirring constantly, until broth is absorbed.  Continue simmering and adding broth, about 3/4 cup at a time, stirring constantly and allowing the broth to be absorbed before adding more, until rice is almost tender and creamy looking, about 18 minutes.
Add the spinach and peas and cook until spinach is wilted.  Add the asparagus and cook just until vegetables are hot.  Stir in the parmesan and more broth if the risotto looks too thick.  Serve!
Mix ingredients together; form into patties
Fry cakes in pan with lots of butter
Optional: roll with breadcrumbs
Beat sugar, margarine and zest; beat in egg yolks.
Beat in lemon juice, flour and milk.
Beat egg whites until soft peaks form and fold in.
Bake at 350 for 40 minutes with a water pan.

Heat medium saucepan over medium heat, add oil.  Wait until oil starts to smoke and add onions.  Sautee for 3 to 4 minutes.  Add garlic, mussels, wine, parsley, salt and pepper.  Cover pan immediately.
Give pan a good shake, and let steam for about two minutes.  Check to see if mussels have opened; if not, let steam another minute.  (Don't cook more than 3 minutes).  Very easy to overcook.
Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve immediately.
Pare, core and slice apples in thin slices.  Place in oiled pan 8"x8".  Sprinkle with 1/8 tsp salt and lemon (rind and juice).
Blend together until crumbly flour, sugar and margarine.  Add 1/4 tsp salt and cinnamon.  Sprinkle over apples.
Bake in moderate oven, 375 till apples are tender 30-35 minutes.  Serve warm with cream.
Mix soft cream cheese and sour cream and spread on bottom of casserole dish.
Add layer of guacamole; enough to cover.
Add layer of chopped onions and peppers.
Add layer of salsa
Top with layer of grated cheese.
Eat with tortilla chips.

211.name: Green Peppercorn and Dijon Steak Sauce

text: Heat butter, sautee garlic and shallots one minute; add stock, cream and mustard.  Reduce stock by half.  Serve over steak.
Wash scallops; dry and roll in crumbs.
Heat butter in pan with worcestershire and lemon.
Pour over scallops in baking dish.
Bake at 450 for 12 minutes.

ingred.name: freshly squeezed lemon or lime juice

text: Rub the chicken with salt and place in a large shallow dish.  Add remaining ingredients and turn chicken until it is coated evenly.  Cover and set aside to marinate for at least 1 hour.
Prepare the grill; cook the chicken over medium heat, turning the pieces after 10 minutes and basting frequently with the marinade for a total of 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve hot.

133.name: Mark Tewkesbury's Recipe for Fantastic Beef Fajitas

text: Prepare marinade by combining peel, juices, garlic, steak sauce and cumin.  Slice steaks across grain into thin (quarter inch) strips and toss with marinade.  Cover and leave for 15 minutes.  Heat tortillas.  Heat pan on high, drain beef strips and sear on both sides for 2-3 minutes.  Top warmed tortilla with beef strips, cheese, lettuce, olives, guacamole, and whatever.
Melt together cream cheese and mayonnaise, add onion then mustard, chili powder and parsley.
Take crab meat, put int earthenware bowl with top of 2 tbsp butter and a dozen crackers crumbed.  10 Minutes in 350 degree oven.  Serve with crackers - very good with triscuit.  Susan Hanrahan, NSDCC

131.name: Greek Beef - Urban Peasant (Modified By Mum)

ingred.name: sirloin or round cut into cubes

text: Soak skewers; skewer 3-4 pieces with small space between.  Brush on dijon mustard.
Prepare hot pan, add oil and put in skewered meat.

Prepare sauce: onion and tomatoes.  Add to pan when meat is browned.  Add salt and pepper, rosemary if available, oregano.  Cook together at high heat for 5 minutes.  Add red wine to make sauce (or use water or stock).
I haven't made this yet but I know it will be delicious.
Remember: mustard is a great prepared sauce to add to cooking, sauces, etc.

130.name: Ginger Beef - Urban Peasant (Modified By Mum)

ingred.name: flank steak (beef, pork steak or chicken breast)

text: Prepare meat: cut into thin slices across the grain.  Prepare cornstarch mixed with soya and pepper.  Toss meat in mixture until well coated.
Prepare hot frypan and add meat mixture.  Add fresh ginger, garlic
Stir together and keep cooking, turn while keeping it hot.
Thow in some green onion (or other veg.), cook a minute and serve (2 people).

Preheat oven to 400.  Saute the chicken then set aside.  Saute the onion, mushrooms and garlic.  Add the chicken, and salt and pepper to taste, and cook for 5 minutes.  Remove from the heat and stir in the yoghurt (sour cream) and nutmeg.  Sprinkle with feta, top with greated swiss, then bake for 15 minutes.

136.name: Chicken Breasts stuffed with herbed cheese

text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper and sprinkle with lemon juice or white wine.
Combine the ricotta, parmesan egg and herbs in a small bowl.  Beat until well blended, season with salt and pepper to taste.
Stuff chicken generously.
Bake for 10 minutes, lower heat to 375 degrees and bake for 30 minutes.
Serve with a crisp dry white or California Sauvingnon Blanc.
2-3 Servings
35 mins (10 minute prep)
Cook meatballs in sauce, 10 minutes.
Serve with lots of crusty bread.

134.name: Beef Stroganoff - Urban Peasant (Modified By Mum)

text: Heat frying pan, then add oil (heating the pan first on hit, the adding the oil reduces sticking).  Sprinkle meat with flour and pepper, coat lightly.  Spread meat on hot oil, turn over when brown.  Add onion, garlic (optional), thyme (optional), sliced mushrooms.
Add about 1 cup of stock (can be any type of stock) and tomato paste.
Cook about 15 minutes @ simmer. Add salt.  At last moment, add sour cream.  Serve on rice, noodles, potatoes, whatever.
Cut tenderloin lengthwise to open flat, make extra slashes in thickest meat.
Combine broccoli & water, cover and microwave at high for one minute, drain and mix with crumbs, walnuts and butter.
Stuff tenderloin and tie tightly with string.
Combine 1tbsp of the tomato sauce, maple syrup and soy sauce, spread over tenderloin and roll in pepper.
Add oil and tenderloins and microwave at high for 4 minutes; turn over and high again for 4 minutes.  Continue until meat is no longer pink in the center.
Add reamining tomato sauce and chicken stock to pan drippings, cook on high 1 1/2 minutes for sauce.

Combine salt, pepper and lemon juice and sprinkle this mixture on both sidse of the fillets.  Butter an ovenproof dish generously, line with chopped shallots and parsley, put in fish and add white wine to cover 2/3 of the fish.  Sprinkle with half the butter melted and bake in a 350 degree oven basting frequently until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Arrange on long hot dish and over with cheesecloth and keep hot.  Boil down the pan juices to a quantity just sufficient to sauce the fish.  Remove from heat, add remaining butter in small pieces, whisking constantly.  Correct seasoning if necessary and pour the sauce which should be quite thick over the fish.
Remember cook fish about 10 minutes per inch of thickness, normally in a hot oven about 400 degrees.
make slit under skin of lamb and insert slices of garlic all over.
place cut onion under the lamb (fat side up) in the roasting pan to maintain seperation.
Pour 1/2"+ of hot water, salt, oregano, pepper into roasting pan.  Add leftover wine if available.
Preheat oven to 400, cook for 10-15 minutes.
Reduce heat to 325
Cook for 2 1/2 - 3 hours (20 minutes per pound); with one hour left, add carrot and potato to water.
During the last half hour, baste with crushed tomatoes and lots of basil.

Wash mushrooms and remove stems.  Chop enough stems or mushrooms to make 1/2 cup.  Oil in hot pan - fry chopped mushroom, onion and galic.  Cook over low heat about 10 miutes till almost a pulp.  Add the rest off heat and mix and fill caps.  Bake 30 min in 325 oven.  This can easily be cooked at different temperatures - just keep an eye on it.  It is a very forgiving recipe.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Slice the top off the apple.  Remove flesh from inside apples with a melon baller, leaving 1/2" shell.  Place apples on a baking sheet.  Cut a slice from base of apples to help them sit upright.
Combine butter and brown sugar in a bowl and brush apples with mixture inside and out.
Place apples in individual ramekins or muffin tins. Bake apples for 20 to 25 minutes or until barely soft.
Heat cream in a pot over medium heat.  Whisk together egg yolks and sugar then whisk in hot cream and calvados.  Pour into apples and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until barely set.  Cool.
Sprinkle each top with about 1/2 tsp sugar.  Place under broiler and broil until sugar browns, about 1 to 2 minutes.  Makes 4 individual servings.  Lucy Waverman
Spread cheese, scallions and peppers to edges of tortilla, season with oregano.

Heat oiled skillet with oil then place second tortilla on top of first and place in skillet for 2 minutes or until cheese begins to melt. Flip and fry for 3 minutes until cheese is melted and begins to ooze and sizzle.
Remove from heat and cut into slices.  Serve with salsa and sour cream.
Variation: Thin slices of tomato or chicken.

ingred.name: potatoes, (2", unpeeled and scrubbed; red bliss are best!)

text: Place potatoes in large saucepan and cover with 1" of cold water, add 1 tsp of salt and bay leaf.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer gently until paring knife can be inserted without resistance (about 34 to 45 minutes).  Save 1/2 cup, then drain and allow potatoes to air dry in pot for about 5 minutes uncovered.

Whisk melted butter and softened cream cheese until smooth add 1/4 cup of reserved cooking water, 1/2 tsp pepper, chives and 1/2 tsp salt.  Using rubber spatula or back of wooden spoon smash potatoes just enough to break skins.  Fold in butter/cream cheese mixture until most of liquid has been absorbed and chunks of potatoes remain.  Add more cooking water 1 tbsp at a time as needed until potatoes are looser than required as they will thicken with standing.
For bacon and parsley (which is what I made) substitute 1 tbsp bacon fat for equal amount of butter and persley for chives and add 6 slices of bacon cooked and cut into 1/4" pieces.
Another version cooks 1/2 tsp rosemary and a minced garlic in butter and adds 2 garlic cloves when cooking potatoes and adds these to butter cream cheese mixture.

15 to 30 minutes before cooking season tenderloins with salt and pepper.  Preheat oven to 400 degrees, prepare middle rack.  Heat skillet over medium high heat with oil till smoking; cook tenderloins till well browned about 1 minute on each side.  Transfer to baking pan and put in oven about 25 minutes.  Transfer to cutting board, tend with foil and let rest 8 to 10 minutes.  Cut crosswise into 1/2" slices and spoon Dried Cherry-Port or Garlicky Lime Sauce with Cilantro over.

ingred.name: drained white or red kidney beans

text: Prepare hot pan, add oil
Add chopped onions, carrots, cook for a few minutes.
Add in order: garlic, potato, tomatoes, cabbage
Add celery, salt & pepper, kidney beans, cook three minutes.
Add macaroni, parsley
Cook 25 minutes, add liquid if necessary; water, tomato juice or stock.
Garnish with parmesan.
We really like white kidney beans better than red ones now ~ can drain the can use what you want and put the rest in the freezer.
Frying carrots in hot oil carmelizes the sugar in them and they become very sweet and delicious.

121.name: Potato Salad with Pimento and Peas

ingred.name: white thin skin potatoes, peeled and diced
small white onion, peeled and whole

text: Boil potatoes in salted water for 12 minutes, until fork tender.  Drain and return potatoes to hot pot to dry them.  Sprinkle potatoes with vinegar.  Transfer potatoes to a bowl and let them cool.
When potatoes have cooled, add pimento and peas to the bowl.  Using a hand held grater, grate the small white onion over the potatoes.  The onion juice is what makes this salad so good.

Add mayonnaise dressing to the bowl, or to your linking to bind.  Season potato salad with salt and pepper to taste.  Transfer to plastice serving wear and pack up for your picnic.  Keep this salad in your cooler with beverages or chill until ready to travel.
Rub pan with garlic
Melt in butter
Stir in flour until blended
Stir in bouillon (1 or 1/2 cup) or cubes.
Stirring constantly, let gravy reach boiling point
Season as required with:
salt, pepper, paprika, dry sherry, worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, ketschup, chili sauce, dried herbs.  (not all at once).  Liz's Joy of Cooking
Sautee mushrooms in butter
Remove mushrooms, add Quick Brown Sauce to drippings.
When sauce is heated, re-add the sauteed mushrooms.  Liz's Joy of Cooking

ingred.name: unpeeled, cut lengthwise, 2" long slivered cucumbers

text: Mix together Salad then toss with Dressing, chill for 30 minutes.
Set power select to medium. In 3-quart casserole dish, combine macaroni, cheese, milk, salt, onion, mustard and pepper.
Heat, covered, 9 to 10 minutes; stirring twice.  Top with bread crumbs and heat, uncovered, for 3 minutes.
Variation:  use 1/2 cup tomato sauce for 1/4 cup milk and a teaspoon of oregano for dry mustard.

Boil water for pasta.  Cook oil and onion on the pan until they start to sweat and become translucent.  Add ground beef, break up and cook until close to brown.  Add red pepper and cook 2 minutes.  Add tomato soup and ketchup, salt, pepper, basil and oregano to taste.  Simmer until pasta finishes, drain pasta and add to sauce.  Stir in bay leaves, bake one hour with cover on.  Alternatively, microwave on high for 15-20 minutes.  Let cool 2 mins and serve.
Mix together to form patties and fry.
In large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.  Add beef, bread crumbs, onion, 1/2 cup of the tomato sauce, salt, worcestershire sauce, 1 tsp of the mustard and pepper, mix well.
Form mixture into 9x5" loaf; place in 11x7" baking dish.  Cover with vented plastic wrap and microwave at HIgh for 5 minutes or until meat is no longer pink, rotating dish once.
Drain off fat.  Microwave, covered, at medium for 10 to 12 minutes or until meat is cooked through, rotating dish twice. Drain off fat.
In bowl, mix together brown sugar, vinegar, remaining tomato sauce and mustard; spread over loaf.  Microwave, uncovered, at Hight for 2 minutes or until sauce is hot.  Makes about 6 servings.

In 12 cup casserole, combine, water, cornmeal and 1 tbsp of the oil.  Cover and microwave on high for 9 to 11 minutes or until water is absorbed, stirring twice.  Stir in 1 cup parmesan and spread evenly in bottom of casserole.  Set aside.

In 8 cup measuring cup or casserole, combine garlic, onion, carrot and celery.  Cover with vented plastic wrap and microwave at high for 3 to 5 minutes or until softened, stirring once.  Stir in beef; microwave, covered, for at high for about 5 minutes or until meat is no longer pink, breaking up meat and stirring once.  Drain off any fat.

Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, basil and hot pepper flakes; microwave, covered, at high for 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened slightly, stirring partway through.  Season with salt and pepper to taste.  Spread over polenta and microwave, covered, at high for 4-5 minutes or until heated through.  Sprinkle with parsley and a little parmesan; garnish with radish sprouts (if using).  Makes 4 servings.

ingred.name: ginger (seems shy to me- guess what I do?)

text: Combine the sugar, margarine, molasses and egg and blend well.  Add flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves.  Blend well.  Chill dough.  Lightly grease cooking sheets.  Heat oven to 375.  Shape dough into 1" balls, roll in sugar.  Place on sheet two inches apart.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes until edges are set.  (Easy to overcook like roasts or flank steak!  However do not tent)  Cool 1 to 2 minutes.  Remove from sheet.
Yummy, Love Mummy

164.name: Dried Cherry-Port sauce with onions and marmalade

text: I think this would be good with cranberries and broth or maybe orange juice.  Add oil to hot skillet after removing tenderloins to oven and heat, add onions (5 to 7 minutes).  Set aside.

While tenderloins are resting, skillet over medium heat add port and cherries, simmer, add juice from oven roasting thicken slightly by reducing over heat 5 to 10 minutes.  Off heat whisk in marmalade and butter and season.
Reserve 1/2 cup noodles.  Toss all other ingredients and place in a 1 1/2 quart casserole.  Sprinkle remaining noodles on top.  Bake 30 minutes at 325.  Serves about 6

Combine butter, brown sugar, egg yolks, flour and baking powder.  Press into 8x8" pan.  Cover in chocolate chips.  Topping: beat egg whites until stiff, add white sugar and pour over chocolate chips.  Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes.
Cook the pasta and the meat seperately.  Once everything is cooked, it goes into a casserole dish for 25 minutes in the oven.

147.name: Roasted Beet, Spinach and Goat Cheese Mix

ingred.name: spinach, chard or kale, steamed and shredded

text: If you don't have small beets, roast the large ones and cut them up afterward.

Preheat oven to 400.  Cut off any beet stems.  Place in a baking dish with about 1/4 cup water.  Season with salt and pepper.  Cover with foil and bake for about 45 minutes to 1 hour or until beets are tender.  Cool.

Peel beets, cutting them in half or quarters, if needed.  Heat oil in large skillet on medium-high heat.  Add spinach and garlic and toss together until spinach wilts.  Add beets, balsamic vinegar and mix together.
Sprinkle with goat cheese and torn basil.  Toss together until cheese is melted.  Serves 6.  Lucy Waverman
Boil sugar, cocoa, butter and milk in the microwave, 2-3 minutes.  Add vanilla, then coconut and oats and microwave again 2-3 minutes.  When hot and properly mixed lay out on wax paper to cool.
Melt margarine, add marshmallows, microwave on low then blend with rice krispies and lay out to cool in a casserole dish.

Beat egg yolks and lemon juice in top of a double boiler and add half the butter cut into small pieces.  Cook slowly adding more of the butter until it is all added and the sauce begins to thicken.  Remove from heat.

ingred.name: cocoa if making chocolate (what other kind is there?)

text: Mix in saucepan and bring to a boil.  Boil for 10 minutes or to soft ball stage.  SOFT BALL stage is when candy makes a soft ball when dropped in cold water.  Remove from heat and stir in 3/4 cup flour.  Beat until smooth.  Spread in buttered dish.  If nuts are desired, spread them on the bottom of the dish first.

Note from Mum: When making fudge be careful not to stir so fast that it crystalizes on the sides of the pan, or if it does do not scape that into the mixture as it will interfere with the solidifying of the dish.  Food Fit for "Queens"

Combine flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl and set aside.  Cream butter until smooth in a large bowl with an electric mixer set on medium speed.  Add the sugars and beat until combined. Add eggs and vanilla and mix thoroughly.  Reduce mixer speed to medium low, add the flour mixture to the egg mixture, and mix until a soft dough forms.  Add chocolate chips and mix to incorporate.  Cover the dough with plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350.  Line 2 baking pans with parchment paper and set aside.  Place the confectioners's sugar in a medium bowl and set aside.  Keeping dough well chilled, shape 1 tbsp of dough into a ball.  Roll the ball in the confectioners' sugar to coat generously -- do not shake off excess sugar.  Place balls 2" apart on prepared baking pans.  Bake until cookies have puffed and cracked and are slightly firm to the touch -- 10 to 12 minutes.  Transfer cookies to a wire rack and cool completely.  Store in an airtight container for up to one week.  Country Living

190.name: Coffee Cake a la Myrtille (Blueberry Coffee Cake)

ingred.name: plain yoghurt or fromage blanc or sour cream

text: Preheat your oven to 360 degrees.  Grease a 9" cake pan, preferably non-stick with a removable bottom.
Sift together the flour, baking powder and baking soda.  Set aside.

In a food processor, mix together the butter and white sugar until fluffy.  Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well between each addition.  Add the yoghurt and vanilla, and mix again.  Add the flour mixture, and mix again until just combined.

Pour half of the cake batter in the cake pan.  Pour half the blueberries over the surface.  Cover with the rest of the batter, top with the remaining blueberries, and sprinkle evenly with the brown sugar.

Bake for an hour, until the top is golden brown and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.  Transfer to a rack, let stand in the pan for ten minutes, then unclasp the sides of the pan and let cool completely before serving.  Chocolate and Zucchini
Preheat oven to 350 degrees
Butter a 2 to 3 quart baking dish and evenly spread out the bread cubes.

In a saucepan combine the half and half, butter, salt and vanilla and heat until hot over moderate heat.  In a bowl whisk together sugar, eggs, and yolks and add hot half and half mixture in a stream, whisking constantly.  Pour mixture over bread cubes.  Bake pudding in middle of oven for about 40 to 45 minutes, or until puffed and golden.  Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.  Food Network

ingred.name: rolled oats or mixed rolled grains

text: If almond butter isn't available, can substitute olive oil or slightly warmed coconut oil.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees and grease a medium baking dish with vegetable oil.
In a medium mixing bowl, combine the oats, ground almonds, coconut and salt.  Set aside.  Chop the chocolate so the largest pieces are about the size of a chocolate chip.  Set aside.
In another medium mixing bowl, combine the bananas, vanilla and almond butter, and mash thoroughly using a potato masher.  Add the oats mixture and mix well.  Fold the chocolate in gently.

Pour into the prepare baking dish, leevl the surface and slip into the oven.  Bake for 25 minutes, until the top is set and golden-brown.  Let cool completely before slicing into bars.  If you're not serving all the bars at once, I suggest you cut only what you need.  Cover the rest with foil and keep at room temperature.  Chocolate and Zucchini
Prepare vegetables and pasta as desired.  Combine rest of ingredients to make marinade.  Let marinate for 24 hours.

114.name: Thai Chicken Wrap with Spicy Peanut Sauce

ingred.name: seedless peeled, sliced cucumber, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced on an angle
rice wine vinegar or white wine vinegar
rice wine vinegar or white wine vinegar

text: Heat a grill pan over high heat.  Toss chicken with soy and oil and grill 6 minutes on each side.
Combine cucumber, sprouts, carrots, scallions, basil, mint and sesame with a generous sprinkle of sugar and vinegar.  Season salad with salt, to taste.
Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar and cayenne together.  Stream in vegetable oil.
Slice cooked chicken on an angle.  Toss with veggies and herbs.
In a very hot non-stick skillet or over a gas burner heat tortillas 15 seconds on each side.
Pile chicken and veggies in wraps and drizzle liberally with spicy peanut sauce before wrapping and rolling.

117.name: Roasted Baby Potatoes with Herbs and Garlic

ingred.name: herbes de provence or dried italian seasoning
fingerling potatoes or small white/red potatoes

text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.  In a large bowl, whisk the oil, herbes de provence, and garlic to blend.  Add all of the potatoes and 1 tsp each of salt and pepper, and toss to coat.  Using a slotted spoon, transfer the potatoes to a large, heavy baking sheet, spacing evently.  Set the bowl aside, do not clean.

Roast the potatoes until they are tender and golden, turning them occasionally, about 1 hour.  Transfer the roasted potatoes to the reserved bowl and toss to coat with any herb oil remining in the bowl.  Season the potatoes with more salt and pepper to taste.  Transfer to a large bowl and serve.  Everyday Italian by Giada.

Cook noodles as directed on package, drain well.  Add sugar, raisins, nuts salt and eggs.  Melt fat in a baking pan (8x12").  Grease the pan and pour the balance of the fat into the noodle mixture.  Blend well and spread mixture in the baking pan.
Sprinkle evenly with cinnamon.  Bake in moderate oven 375 degrees for 55 mintues or until evenly browned.
This is the best lochen recipe I have found.  I usually cover it with foil for most of the cooking.
I often make one with apple slices instead of raisins ~ Nick prefers this.  I never add nuts but would be nice ~ I'd use a mild one like almonds.  Manischewitz package.
Saute onion in butter until tender in a large skillet or kettle.  Combine remaining ingredients and add to onion.  Heat well without browning, stirring frequently.
I usually use a mixture of mashed potato and bread crumbs - whatever I have I suppose, but
at least 50/50.  I add milk or stock (chicken or vegetable juice) if I am cooking it in a casserole.
Yields 5 to 6 cups, Enough for neck and body cavity of a 10 to 12 lb turkey or two roasting chickens.  Five Roses Cookbook
Melt butter in large saucepan, add onion and cook til tender but not brown.  Add ground beef, sprinkle with chili powder, salt, paprika and Tabasco.  Cook meat until brown, breaking it up.

Add tomatoes, tomato sauce and paste and cover and simmer for 45 minutes.  Add kidney beans and simmer for another 15 minutes.  Makes 12 servings.  Recipe can easily be modified (mushrooms, chickpeas, whatever).
Cook potatoes until they are fork tender in boiling water.  Drain the potatoes and cool them completely.
Soak the rasins in hot water for 15 minutes then drain.  Combine all the ingredients and mix them thoroughly, but gently.
Chill for 24 hours before serving.  Food Network
Put oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Halve each potato lengthwise, then cut each half lengthwise into 4 wedges.

Toss potato wedges with oil, salt, and pepper in a 17 by 11" shallow baking pan (1" deep) and arrange in 1 layer.  Roast potatoes, turing over once, until golden brown and cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes.
Sprinkle with 2 tbsp vinegar, shaking pan to distribute vinegar evenly, then roast until vinegar is evaporated, about 3 minutes.
Serve sprinkled with remaining 1/2 tablespoon vinegar and salt to taste.
Boil for 1 1/2 hrs meat, bone, water, salt, pepper and grated onion.
Add sliced cabbage and boil until soft
Add 1 can tomatoes, sugar and ketchup
Soup needs 3 hrs to boil!!!
Note: Two cans of toamtoes makes a superior soup.  Grandma Z's Little Jewish Cookbook
Preheat 350 degrees F
Boil yams till slightly underdone, strain, cool, set aside.
Whisk together Oj, corn syrup, sinnamon, nutmeg, vanilla and zest.
In a seperate bowl whisk flour and sugars
Put cooled yams in deep baking dish, add dry ingredients.
Pour liquid over yams and bake for 20-25 minutes.
Beat together Yam base, lay in casserole dish.  Beat together topping, pour on top.  Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees.
See Dried cherry port sauce; same cooking.
I actually used grated fresh ginger, no pepper flakes or cilantro or chives.  This makes a wonderful sauce with ginger lime flavour.
As dictated by Edie Zwerling ~ 1970's

Rub the chicken with garlic and salt and place in a nonmetallic dish or heavy plastic bag.  Combine the remaining ingredients and add to the chicken.  Marinate in a cool place at least 1 hour, or refregerate for up to 2 days.  When grill is medium hot cook chicken legs, turing the pieces after about 10 minutes and basting them frequently with the marinade for a total of about 30 minutes, until they are golden brown.
If the chicken is browning too quickly, move to a cooler part of the grill.  Serve hot or at room temperature.  Serves 6

Sprinkle the yeats in warm water in which 1 tsp of sugar has been dissolved; let stand 15 minutes, then stir well.  Dissolve remaining sugar, salt, shortening and molasses in 4 cups hot water and cool to lukewarm.

Stir in yeast mixture.  Combine the all-purpose flour and the cracked wheat; add have the flour miture to yeast mixture and beat well.  Add remaining flour and beat it until mixture is too difficult to mix with a spoon.  Turn dough out onto a floured board and knead until smooth (about 10 minutes). Shape into two smooth balls and place in two greased bowls; turn balls of dough over in bowls to grease surface.

Cover and let rise in a warm (80-85) and humid place until double in bulk (about 1 hour).  Punch down, let rise again until double in bulk (about 1/2 hour); punch down again and turn out on lightly floured board.

Divide dough into 4 equal portions and round up into balls; cover and let rest 10 minutes.  Mould into loaves and place in greased 9"x5"x3" loaf pans.  Cover and let rise until double in bulk (About 1 hour).  Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes.  Five Roses Cookbook
Mom's note: use cooler oven.

Sautee chopped onions in butter, add diced potatoes and 3 cups boiling water.  Then cut fish in pieces and add to potatoes, onion and let simmer.  Add salt and pepper to taste.  Just before serving pour in the canned milk.  Serves 4.

Pour boiling water over oats.  Let stand about 1/2 hour.  Sprinkle yeast and 1 tsp sugar into lukewarm water; let stand 10 minutes, then stir.  Add molasses, sugar, salt and butter to the cooled oatmeal; blend well.
Stir in dissolved yeast.  Add enough flour to make a soft dough.  Turn out on floured board and knead until smooth and elastic - about 10 minutes.  Place in a greased bowl; turn to grease top.

Cover with a clean towel and let rise in a warm place (80-85 degrees) until double in bulk - about 1 hour.  Punch down and knead lightly for 2 minutes.  Divide dough in half and shape into loaves.  Place into 2 greased 9"x5"x3" loaf pans.  Cover and let rise until double in bulk - about 1 hour.  Bake in hot over (400 degrees). 44-55 minutes.  Five Roses Cookbook
Mom's note: 350-370 degree oven for 35 minutes.
Place the avocado, lemon juice, butter, oregano and 3/4 tsp of the salt in a food processor. Pulse until nearly smooth, about 30 seconds.  Set aside.

Place a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat.  Coat with vegetable cooking spray.  Sprinkle the salmon with the remaining salt.  Place in heated skillet.  Cook until just cooked through, about 3 minutes per side.  Transfer to a plate.  Assemble 2 sandwiches, alternating pumpernickel, avocado butter, salmon, and arugula.
Have all ingredients at room temperature.

Oven at 350.  Cream together yoghurt, cheese, eggs, sweetening and flavouring.  Pour into crust, leaving a little space at top.  (this depends on pan size of course!).  Bake for 50 minutes or until crack appears on surface.  (usually takes a bit longer in my oven)
Remove from oven and increase temp to 400.  Mix topping ingredients and spoon gently onto top of cake and return to oven for 5 minutes.  Cool.  Chill before eating.  Love Mum

ingred.name: small blue/yellow plums, halved and pitted (750g)

text: Slit open vanilla bean and, using a small knife, scrape out seeds.  Add bean and seeds to a wide pot.  Add water, sugar, cinnamon and lemon peel.  Bring to a boil over high heat and boil for 3 minutes.
Turn heat to low, add plums to simmering syrup and poach until tender (about 10 minutes).  Let plums cool in syrup.
Remove 2 cups syrup and bring to a boil in a seperate pot.  Boil for about 8 or until the syrup coats the back of a spoon.  It thickens as it cools.

Combine the marscapone, yogurt and honey.  Place a spoonful of plums in the bottom of each of 4 parfait glasses.  Drizzle over some syrup.  Top with a layer of marscapone cream.  Repeat layers.  Top with a sprig of lemon balm, another syrup drizzle and serve with a fancy cookie.  Serves 4 to 6.
Add dill pickle mayonaise, wild rocket, cucumber ribbons and pickled ginger to serve.

Cut the salmon into chunks.  Place in a bowl with the capers, lime, dill, egg white and rice flour and toss to combine.  Divide into 4 and shape into burgers.  Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over high heat.  Cook the salmon for 1-2 minutes each side or until just cooked through.  Brush the bun halves with olive oil and place on a baking tray.  Grill under a preheated hot grill for 1 minute or until golden.  Set aside.  Spread the buns with dill pickle mayonaise and top with the salmon, rocket, cucumber and pickled ginger to serve.

ingred.name: carrots, scraped and sliced 1/4 inch thick
honey or syrup or 1 cup sugar

text: Cook carrots in water 8 to 10 minutes until tender enough to pierce with a toothpick.
Add salt, honey, syrup/sugar and lemon juice.  Let simmer gently for 20 minutes or until liquid is reduced.
Brown flour in melted butter and add to pot shaking pot to evenly distribute.  Cook 5 minutes longer.
This recipe can be adjusted easily smaller or bigger.
Adjust oven rack to lower-middle position; heat oven to 350.  Sprinkle both sides of chicken thighs with salt and pepper.

Heat oil in pan over medium high heat until shimmering but not smoking; add chicken thighs skin down and cook without moving them until skin si crisped and well browned, 10 to 12 minutes.  Using tongs, turn chicken pieces and brown on second side, about 5 minutes longer.  Transfer to large plate.

Pour off all but 1 tsp fat from pot.  Add onion and tomato paste and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally and craping bottom of pot with wooden spoon, until tomato paste begins to darken (about 4 minutes; if bottom of pot becomes dark and stickly stir in 1 or 2 tbsp of water).

Add garlic and anchovy and cook, stirring constantly until fragrant about 1 minute.  Stir in tomatoes, chicken broth, win, scraping up browned bits with wooden spoon.  Add red pepper flakes, thyme and bay.  Remove and discard skin from chicken thighs, the submerge chicken bone side up in liquid, adding any chicken juices accumulated on plate.
Increase heat to high, bring to simmer, cover, then place pot in oven.  Cook until chicken offers no resistance - 40 to 50 minutes.

While chicken cooks, trim stems from chard.  Cut stems crosswise tinto 1/4" pieces, halve leaves lengthwise, then cut crosswise into 1/4" strips.  Set stems and leaves aside sparately.  Simmer balsamic vinegar over medium-high heat until thick, syrupy and reduced to 1/4 cup, 3 to 5 minutes (vinegar clings to side of pot).  Set aside.
Using slotted spoon, transfer chicken to plate and tent with foil; discard bay leaf.  Bring liquid to simmer over medium high heat; add chard stems and cook until almost tender, about 8 minutes.
Add chard greens and cook until wilted, about two minutes.  Stir about 1/3 cut of sauce into balsamic reduction, then stir this mixture into sauce.  Add salt and pepper as desired.
Return chicken and juices to sauce, cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.  Serve with chicken thighs on top of chard and sauce poured over.  Lends itself to moderate changes. (Mum)
Stir the brown sugar and oil together.  Add the eggs and stir thoroughly.  Sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and add to the sugar mixture.  Blend well.  Add the vanilla and the nuts.
Bake at 350 in a greased 8" square pan for about 25 minutes.
These taste best if they're slightly chewy.  Don't overcook or they'll get hard.
Mix together wafer crumbs and margarine for crumb, put in pan.
Mix the cream cheese and the white sugar till creamy with beater.  Stir in Coolwhip.   Add berries and chill.
Preheat oven to 375
Cut broccoli and cauliflower heads into florets, about 2 inches in size.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.  Add broccoli and cauliflower and boil until crisp tender, about 3 minutes.
Drain and run under cold water until cool.  Place in bowl.

Melt 2 tbsp butter in a skillet on medium heat.  Add onion and saute until softened, about 3 minutes.  Add 2 tsp of garlic and cook one minute.  Stir saute mix into vegetable mixture along with sour cream and 3/4 cup Parmesan.
Pulse mixture in a food processor in batches until combined but still chunky.  Season well with salt, pepper and nutmeg.  Spoon mixture into a buttered gratin dish.
Combine remaining Parmesan cheese with bread crumbs, 1 tbsp melted butter and remaining teaspoon garlic.  Sprinkle over broccoli mixture.
Bake for 20 minutes or until mixture is hot and bubbling.  If topping is not golden, broil for 1 to 2 minutes.  Serves 6 to 8.
Preheat oven to 425.  Grease a cookie sheet.

Combine dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl.  Work butter or margarine into dry ingredients until butter is the size of small peas using a pastry blender or fork.  Add remaining ingredients, mixing just until dry ingredients are moist.
Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and gather into a ball.  Pat into a circle 3/4-inch thick; cut into 8 wedges.  Place on cookie sheet.  Sprinkle with sugar.
Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown.  Makes 8 scones.

Per Serving (1 scone): Cal 284, Total fat 12g, Sat. Fat 72g, protein 4gg, carb 39g, dietary fiber 2g, sugar 14g, vit a 131RE, Folate 12Ug, vit e < 1mg, vit C < 1mg, sodium 344mg, pot. 52mg, iron 2mg, calcium 88mg, zinc < 1mg.
Cut pepper squash in two
Oil, salt and pepper on inside
Fill with ground sausage
Grate cheese on top, bake/microwave.
350 degree oven
place pieces in large bowl, combine other ingredients and mix
drizzle spice mix over squash, coat well
Bake squash skin down on baking sheet and brushon remaining oil/spices
Roast 30-40 mins until tender.  Serve as is or mash!
Toss cheese and flour
Heat beer until boiling
Add cheese (just 1/2) + other ingred.
Stir, 1 - 1 & 1/2 min.
Add the rest of the cheese & stir cooking for 2-3 min.
Serve on toast points
Put on stock and water to simmer
Cook butter, garlic, onion, stir in rice
Add stock, white wine
Cook/stir until rice is creamy & tender
Add 1/2c parmesan & cook for another 2 minutes then add thyme.
Allow batter to soak for 1 hour.
Crepes will be cooked before they are brown
Otherwise cook as normal crepes.

ingred.name: round steak cut in 1/4 x 1/4 x 2 inch strips

text: Melt 2 tbsp butter in frying pan.  Add onions, saute until golden, then remove and set aside.
Melt 2 tbsp butter.  Add mushrooms and saute until lightly browned then remove and set aside.
Melt 2 tbsp butter in the fryng pan.  Roll round steak in flour. Saute in butter until browned.
Add bouillon, salt and onions.  Cover ans simmer gently until beef in tender (1 1/2 hours).
Then add tomato paste, worcestershire sauce, sour cream, heavy cream and the mushrooms.
Heat thoroughly.  Mum's advice - heat the mixture with the cream added carefully over low heat so the sauce doesn't seperate.
Fry lentils until they darken to red/brown
Add lentils to rice, mix
Heat olive oil, butter, garlic, ginger
Wash rice & lentil mixture twice, add to garlic & ginger
Stir together & heat
Add water & salt
Add cinnamon & little green fat seeds
Cook rice as per normal
Melt butter on high & brown onions & garlic
Add shrimp, cook until pink, set aside & keep warm
Deglaze pan with win & let boil down to 1/3.  Add broth
Add pistachios, saffron/tumeric and let simmer for a few minutes on medium heat.
Add the cream, season to taste, then add cooked shrimp.
Serve with vegetable rice.
Wonton wrappers at room temperature for the packaging.
Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl.
Dip 2 edges of the wonton wrapper in water, add 1/2 tsp of the mixture to the middle.  Squeeze to seal, push out remining air.  Make 2 pleats on each side.
Heat pan over medium heat with a thin layer of vegetable oil.  Evenly space 8-10 potstickers on pan.  Do not touch for 2 minutes
Add 1/3 cup of chicken broth, clamp on lid and reduce heat to low.  Leave for 2 minutes.
Remove from pan, add to alumn. cone in oven to keep warm.  Deglaze pan.
Can use 1/4 lb fresh mushrooms instead, thinly sliced.

Prepare chicken broth.  If using dried mushrooms, soak in warm water 20 minutes.  Drain mushrooms, reserving liquid.  Strain mushroom liquid.  Rinse mushrooms under cold running water.  Squeeze to remove as much moisture as possible.  If using fresh mushrooms, saute in 2 tbsp butter until golden; set aside.

Heat broth in a medium saucepan.  Melt 1/4 cup butter in a large saucepan.  When butter foams, add onion.  Sautee over medium heat until pale yellow.  Add rice and mix well.  When rice is coated with butter, add wine.  Cook, stirring constantly, until wine has evaporated.  Add drained dried mushrooms and reserved mushroom liquid.  Stir in 1 or 2 ladles of broth, or enough to cover rice.  Stir over medium heat until broth has been absorbed.

Continue cooking and stirring rice, adding broth a little at a time until rice is done, 15 to 20 minutes.  Rice should be tender, but firm to the bite.  Stir in parmesan cheese, 1 tbsp butter and sauteed fresh mushrooms, if using.  Season with salt.  Place in a warm dish, serve immediately.  Makes 6 servings.  Cooks.com
Preheat oven to 350.  Grease a 9-inch round cake pan and line bottom of pan with parchment paper.
Toss together plums, 1/3 cup sugar and cinnamon.  Reserve.
Use an electric mixer to beat eggs, 3/4 cup sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until pale and thick.  Blend in oil and orange juice.
Sift together flour, baking powder and salt in a separate bowl.  Gradually add flour mixture to egg mixture, folding together until batter is blended and smooth.  Reserve.
Spread batter into prepared cake pan.  Artfully arrange plums over surface of batter and press them down slightly to partly submerge.  Drizzle any juice over top.
Bake for 1 hour to and hour and 10 minutes in lower third of oven, or until cake tester comes out clean.
Cool in pan.  Slice and serve, warm or cold.  Serves 4 with leftovers for breakfast the next morning.

Heat oven to 325.  Blend butter, 2 cups flour and 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar.  Pat into ungreased 13"x9"x2" pan.  Bake for 18 to 20 minutes.  For filling, blend together eggs, sugar, 4 tablespoons flour, lemon juice and lemon peel.  Pour over first layer.
Return to oven and bake at 325 for 20 minutes.  Loosen around edges, cut into bars and sift confectioners' sugar over the top while warm.

Cake: Pour boiling water over chocolate and butter.  Add vanilla and sugar.  Allow to cool so eggs won't cook when added.  Whisk in egg yolks.  Beat egg whites and fold into mixture, whisking only enough to disperse and blend in the whites.  Pour into greased (with shortening, preferably) and floured pan.  Bake in preheated 350 oven for 50 minutes, approx.
Glaze: Combine sugar, cocoa and butter.  Add vanilla and gradually add milk, to achieve the desired consistency, stirring until smooth.
Turn your oven on to 375 degrees
In a small pan, melt the butter.  When it's hot, add both sugars.  Stir, then let cool a bit.
While the butter mixture is cooling, mix the flour, soda and salt in the mixing bowl.
In a small bowl, beat the egg lightly with a fork, then add the egg and vanilla to the butter mixture.  Stir.
Now add the butter, egg and vanilla to the flour mixture in the mixing bowl.  Stir again, then add chocolate chips and nuts if you want them.
Stir everything until it's all mixed up well and put the bowl in the refrigerator to cool for about an hour.
Bake on ungreased cookie sheet for 8-9 minutes.  Allow to cool.

252.name: Red Velvet Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting

ingred.name: unsalted butter (if using salted, omit 1/2 tsp salt)

text: Cupcakes:  Preheat oven to 325; melt butter and set aside to cool.

In a bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, salt and cocoa powder.  In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat together the sugar, melted butter and oil for 4 minutes on medium speed until the mixture is smooth.
Add half the dry ingredients into the bowl, reduce heat to low speed and mix until just incorporated.  Add the buttermilk and blend.
Add the remaining dry ingredients.

Finish by adding the red food colour paste.  Line muffin tins with 15 cupcake liners and spoon the batter 3/4 of the way up into each liner.  Bake the cupcakes for 20 to 25 minutes.  Cupcakes are done when a toothpick inserted in the centre comes out clean.
Set aside to cool.
Frosting:  In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat together the cheese and butter until well-blended and smooth.  Add the salt and vanilla extract and beat for 1 minute until completely incorporated.
Last, add the icing sugar 1 cup at a time, making sure to beat well in between each addition.  Let frosting rest for at least 20 minutes before decorating cupcakes.
Assemble the cupcakes by piping the frosting in a spiral pattern over the top of the cupcake and decorate with coloured sprinkles.
Mix ingredients thoroughly and pour over pork chops.  Cover and bake 350 for 1 hour, uncover and bake 20-30 mins more.  From Aunt Sheila
Sweat onion with butter, add mushrooms and season with salt.
Stir until it reduces to 1/3 of original.
Add milk, reduce until pasted (sp?)
Add provalone cheese, stir until pot pie consistancy.  Add salt and pepper to taste.
Add two crepes to the bottom of the pan ('Basic Crepes')
Ladel-on thin layer of duxelle, sprinkle with chopped chives
Repeat x 8
Sprinkle top layer with Parmesan.
Cook in a 250 oven for enough time to warm it, 10-15 minutes.
Slice and serve.

Seperate the romain lettuce and wash the leaves under cold running water.  Dry each leave thoroughly with paper towels.  Then wrap the lettuce in a dry kitchen towel and chill while you assemble the other ingredients.  Cut a loaf of bread into 1 1/2-inch-thick slices.  Trim and cut each slice into 1 1/2-inch squares.  In a heavy skillet, large enough to hold all the croutons in one layer, heat 4 tbsp of the vegetable oil over high heat until a light haze forms above it.  Add the croutons and brown them on all sides, turning them with tongs and, if necessary, add up to another 4 tbsp of oil.  Remove the pan from the heat, then add the chopped garlic and toss the croutons about in the hot fat.  Remove the croutons to paper towels to drain, cool and crisp.

Plunge the eggs into rapidly boiling water for 10 seconds, remove and set aside.  Break the chilled romaine into serving-sized pieces and scatter them in the bottom of a large salad bowl, preferably glass or percelain.  Add the salt, pepper and olive oil and toss the lettuce with two large spoons or, better still, with your hands.  Then break the eggs on top of the salad, add the lemon juice and mix again until the lettuce is thoroughly coated with the dressing.  Add the cheese and the anchovies, if you are using them, and mix once more.  Scatter the croutons over the top and serve at once on chilled salad plates.

ingred.name: sliced almonds, toasted and roughly chopped
toasted and ground hazelnut (or other nut)

text: Chop chocolate into approx. 1 to 2 cm pieces and place in a bowl.
Bring cream, rum and butter to simmer
Pour over chopped chocolate and let stand for 2 minutes
Once 2 minutes have elapsed, using a spatula, gently stir in circular motions, starting at the centre of the bowl and working outward until chocolate is completely melted and blended in
Let mixture cool, and then chill in refrigerator until firm, approx. 2 hrs (longer if larger batch is being made)
Using a spoon, scoop out 1 inch pieces of the firm mixture and roll between the palms of the hands to round
Once all the truffles have been rolled, half of the truffle rounds can be dropped, one by one, into a bowl of cocoa powder (or whatever garnish you choose)
Remove the truffles from the cocoa powder and shake in a sieve to remove excess powder
Roll the remaining half of the truffles in sliced almonds (or whichevr garnish you choose)
Place each truffle in a truffle or candy cup and serve or package into small boxes as gifts.

ingred.name: light sour cream or plain yoghurt

text: Peel parsnips; cut into 1" cubes.  In pot of boiling salted water, cook parsnips and onion until tender, about 10 minutes.  Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of the cooking water.

In food processor, puree together parsnips, onion, cooking water, sour cream, salt and pepper untils smooth.  Transfer to warmed serving bowl.  Stir in half each of the parsley and bacon.  Sprinkle with remaining parsley and bacon.  Serves 6.  Canadian Living

Beat eggs lightly in medium bowl.  Add pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and salt; stir until well combined.  Blend in milk.  Pour filling in pie shell.  Bake at 425 15 min.  Reduce oven temperature to 350 and continue baking 30 to 35 min. longer or until knife inserted in centre comes out clean.  Cool.  Makes 1 pie.  Serves eight.  Preparation time: 35 minutes, baking time 45-50 minutes.

Brownie: Melt chocolate and butter over hot water in a microwave on medium 4 minutes; remove and blend well.  Cool.  Beat eggs until lemon coloured.  Gradually add sugar, beating until thick, about 3 minutes.  Stir in chocolate mixture.  Fold in flour, vanilla and nuts.  Pour into two greased and floured 8-inch square pans.  Bake 350 for 35 to 40 minutes (Do not overbake.  These brownies should be very moist in the centre.)  Freezes well.
Toppings:  Sprinkle with chopped nuts and Baker's semi-sweet chocolate chips before baking.  Sprinkle cooled brownies with icing sugar.
Glaze:  Melt 1 square Baker's unsweetened chocolate with 1 tbsp butter and 1/4 cup milk; blend until smooth.  Add 1 1/4 cups icing sugar; blend well.  Spread over 1 pan cooled brownies.
Rocky Road:  Sprinkle 2 cups mini-marshmallows over 1 pan warm brownies.  Broil under pre-heated broiler until golden brown.  Drizzle with 1 square melted Baker's semi-sweet chocolate.
Tip:  If desired, halve all ingredients to make one 8-inch pan.
Prepare crepes according to recipe 'Basic Crepes'
Heat ingredients over medium heat until sugar melts and liquid reduces.  Add 1/4 lb butter softened; when sauce starts to tighten up, add crepes one at a time, folded into quarters.
Serve with ice cream and a little sauce!
The Flambe is just for show!
Brown onions, beef, and garlic in the olive oil for ten minutes.
Add everything else.  Cover pot and simmer over low heat for 3 hours.  It makes a very thick sauce, but you can add more water as it cooks away if you want it thinner.
Meanwhile, in one bowl mix together : 2 lbs ricotta, 1 egg
In another bowl, grate 1 1/2 lbs mozzarella
Then, just before the sauce is done, fill a giant pot with water and bring it to a boil.  When it's boiling add 2 lbs lasagne noodles and cook 10 minutes.
When the noodles are done, drain them and return to pot.  Coer with cold water to prevent them from sticking together.  If you don't have a giant pot, cook the noodles in two batches.

Now, spread some sauce on the bottom of your big roaster pan, then cover completely with a layer of noodles.  Spread some ricotta mixture on the noodles, then sprinkle with some mozzarella.  Repeat layers until everything is used up, ending with sauce.  Sprinkle a lot of mozzrella cheese on top.
Bake at 375 for 30 minutes.  Just before you take it out of the oven, turn on the broiler to make the top crusty and brown.
Tastes better the second day!  From the Eat Good Revival

Cream shortening and sugar together. Add molasses and eggs and beat together well.  Add milk and then bran.  Combine flour, baking powder, soda and salt together.  Add to liquid ingredients.  Add raisins, if desired.  Place in greased muffin pans.  Bake in 400 degree oven for 18 to 20 minutes.  Makes one dozen large muffins.

248.name: Whtie Fish with mushrooms a la Mummy

text: Butter baking dish and place fish fillets in it and sprinkle with salt, pepper and paprika if you have it (or you can put ketchup on in a thin layer or mayonaise).  Top with sliced mushrooms sauteed in butter or use a can of mushrooms.  Cover and bake in a 375 oven 10 minutes and remove cover to finish when fish flakes.  Can also add a small amount of liquid milk, white wine or water if you want to.  I often do because then the pan is easier to clean!
Generally any white fish can be substituted in a recipe - cod, sole(flounder), haddock or halibut and probably any others!
Now I am going to help clean up and get ready for Studio Rally.  Talk to you later.  Make sure you get out for a walk today.  Love Mum
Boil together raisins, sugar and water for 5 mins.  When cool, add shortening, salt, flour, spices and baking soda.  Bake in medium oven for almost an hour.

Helpful Mum Tip: There are many recipes - it was after all created from substitution I suppose.  I used 10oz of raisins, big fat ones are best.  I used becel, I'm sure you could use vegetable oil.  Each spice was 1tsp.  I cooked it in a long loaf pan - 1 hour worked.  I lined the pan with parchment paper - I never have before - greased normally - good luck!  Love Mum.

Boil raisins in water for 10 minutes.  Add lard, let it melt.  Sift dry ingredients together and add to raisins/lard in pan.  Add egg.  Pour into greased loaf pans.  Bake for 45 mins to 1 hour at 350.

Stir flour, baking powder and salt together.  Cream shortening, gradually add sugar, creaming well between additions.  Add egg and vanilla and beat until light and fluffy.  Stir in dry ingredients alternately with milk.  Pour into a well greased 7" x 11" shallow pan.  Peel and core apples; cut in eights.  Place in rows on batter with sharp edges pressed in slightly.  Sprinkle sugar and cinnamon on top. Bake in a moderate oven (350) for 50 to 60 minutes.  Serve hot.  Note:  Peaches or apricots (dried or canned) may be substituted for the apples.  Omit cinnamon in topping.  Five Roses Cookbook

181.name: Nova Scotia Hot Fudge Pudding Cake

text: Heat oven to 350 degrees.  In mixing bowl, mix flour, sugar, 2 tbsp cocoa, baking powder and salt.  Stir in milk, shortening and nuts.  Pour batter into ungreased baking pan 9"x9"x2".  Stir together brown sugar and 1/4 cup cocoa.  Sprinkle over batter in pan.  Pour hot water on batter.  Bake 45 minutes.  White hot, cut pudding in squares, invert onto dessert plates, and spoon sauce over each.
Serve with whipped cream, serves 9.  If using self-rising flour, omit baking powder and salt.  The Masthead News

Beat cream cheese and butter together.  Add vanilla, icing sugar, brown sugar, chocolate and mix well.  Chill for a couple of hours or overnight, then form in ball.  Before serving roll in or sprinkle over with cocoa, hot chocolate mix or whatever you want.  Serve with chocolate wafers.  You can make this ahead and freeze!
Heat oven to 275 degrees.  Draw 9" circle on parchment paper.
Beat egg whites and salt until stiff.  Add next three ingredients and beat.  Combine sugar and cornstarch and add to egg whites one tbsp at a time.  Beat until THICK and glossy.
Spread meringue mix on paper.  Bake 1 hr then turn off heat and leave in oven until cool.  Top with fresh fruit.  May Fowler's recipe.

Preheat the oven to 450.  Beat eggs, milk, flour and salt until smooth.  In a heavy skillet, melt 1 1/2 tbsp butter.  When butter is quite hot, pour in the batter and put the skillet in the oven.  After 15 minutes, lower the oven temperature to 350 degrees and continue baking for another 10 minutes.  If pancake bubbles, pierce it with a fork and push it down.

While the pancake is baking, prepare the filling.  Peel and thinly slice a pound of apples.  Sautee them lightly in butter and add sugar.  Season to taste with cinnamon and nutmeg.  The apples should be just tender, not too soft.
When the pancake is ready, slide it onto a platter and pour the filling over one side then fold-over.  Melted butter and icing sugar can be poured over top.
Boil syrup ingredients together for 10 minutes.  Put in baking dish and add the batter.  Drop by spoonful into the syrup and bake in 350 degree oven for half an hour.  Chrissy St.Germaine

Melt butter, sugar and nutmeg in a pan and add liqueur.  Add bananas, poach for 1 minute each side, medium-low heat.  Remove bananas, bring sauce back to simmer.  Dim lights pour in alcohol and ignite, cooking for another 30 seconds.  Add orange zest and sauce your bananas.

189.name: Gateau de Mamy a la Poire

text: Preheat the oven to 350.  Melt the butter in a small bowl and set aside to cool.  Butter a non-stick 8" cake pan.  Wash, peel and cut up the pears, lay the pieces of fruit at the bottom of the pan.

In a food processor or a medium mixing bowl, blend the sugar with the eggs until the mixture whitens slightly.  Add in the flour, almond powder and baking powder and blend well.  Pour in the butter, and blend again.  Pour the batter evenly over the fruit, and put into the oven to bake for 40 to 50 minutes.

Let the cake settle on a cooling rack for a few minutes.  Invert it on a place (the fruit side will be on top).  If any bit of fruit has stuck to the bottom of the pan, simply scrape them and place them back where they belong on the cake.  Use a second plate to invert the cake again (the fruit side will then be ate the bottom). Let cool and serve slightly warm or at room temperature.  Chocolate and Zucchini

ingred.name: scallions sliced (chopped onion or green onion)

text: Mix together all except the cheese.  Spoon into buttered baking dish.  Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.  Bake at whatever (375 is probably best) about 35 to 45 minutes.  Sits well waiting in oven.

Oil in hot pan, add onions and cook for a few minutes.  Add sugar, paprika, dry mustard, pepper.  Cook a bit together. Add vinegar, worcestershire sauce, tabasco, ketchup and water.  Boil together a couple of minutes to reduce.  Great for saving meatloaf.

Stir flour, baking powder and salt together.  Cream shortening; gradually add sugar, beating between additions.  Add egg yolks and beat until fluffy.  Add dry ingredients, alternately with milk, blending well after each addition.  Stir in vanilla.  Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry; fold into batter.  Pour into two greased and floured or lined 8" layer cake pans.  Bake in a moderate oven (350) 25 to 30 minutes or until done.  Frost as desired.

Use a rather large mixing bowl--the batter will rise to double its original volume.  Put the water in a mixing bowl and sprinkle in the yeast.  Let stand to dissolve for 5 minutes.  Add the milk, butter, salt, sugar and flour to the yeast mixture and beat until smooth and blended.  Cover with plastic wrap and let stand overnight at room temperature.  Just before cooking the waffles, beat in the eggs, add the baking soda and stir until well mixed.  The batter will be very thin.  Pour about 1/2 - 3/4 cup batter into a very hot waffle iron.  Bake until golden and crisp (2 mins).  This batter will keep for several days in the refrigerator.

Note from David:  If you are concerned about leaving the yeast mixture on the counter overnight with milk in it, you could probably put the mixture in the refrigerator, then take it out 1 hour before you plan to use it.
Combine smoked Spanish paprika, thyme, rosemary, fennel seeds, peppercorns, garlic, brown sugar and 2 tbsp oil.  Rub all over brisket and let sit for 30 minutes.  Season brisket with salt.
Preheat oven to 450
Heat remaining 2 tbsp oil in a large roasting pan and add brisket.  Place in oven, uncovered, for 15 minutes or until beginning to brown.
Reduce heat to 325

Cover tightly with a lid and foil and bake for 2 hours.  Remove cover and add stock and tomatoes and cook covered 1 more hour.  Add carrots and onions, pushing them down into liquid, and cook, covered, another hour or until brisket is fork tender and vegetables are soft.  Remove from heat and let cool.
Remove fat from gravy and slice brisket in thin slices.  Return to pan to reheat at 350 for 30 minutes when needed.

Note:  If you are using this for Passover, the sauce cannot be thickened with flour, but for other uses cook together 3 tbsp flour and 3 tbsp oil until browned and then stir the mixture into the sauce.  Bring to a boil, simmer 5 minutes, then pour back over the brisket.

Cook the lentils, rice, garlic, tomato, chillies, tumeric powder, salt in a cooker/pot till the rice and lentils are well cooked.  Heat the oil, put the mustard seeds and let it splutter, add the chopped onions (half of a whole onion) and saute it.  Add this content to the rice and lentils, stir well, add the clarified butter on top of it.  Serve the rice with pickle/yoghurt/crackers.  Enjoy it!!!

Place the oil in a non-stick skillet over high heat, add the onions and saute until dark golden brown.  Add the garlic and ginger, reduce the heat to medium and cook for 2 minutes.  Add the tomato paste and cumin seeds and cook for 30 seconds.

Reduce the heat to low, add the garam masala, brown sugar, red pepper flakes, tumeric and salt and cook for 2 minutes.  Mix in the chicken and cook until the chicken is almost done, about 5-7 minutes.  Add the yogurt and water, and cook until the chicken is fully cooked, about 5 minutes.  Serve it with brown rice or plain rotis.
Note:  Feel free to use whipping cream instead of yogurt.  Even I give in and indulge from time to time!
Cake:  Combine oil, sugar and honey and mix well.  Sift flour and dry ingredients together.  Sift 1/2 of dry ingredients into sugar mixture and blend well.

Sift in remaining dry ingredients, alternating with eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.  Add carrots and mix well.  Add wheat germ and mix well, then add chopped pecans and mix well.  Pour into lightly oiled 10" tube pan and bake at 325 for about 1 hour 10 minutes.  Cool in pan upright.  Or bake in 2 layers (10" layer pans) at 350 for 40 minutes.
Frosting:  Soften together cream cheese and butter and then mix thoroughly, then mix the rest of the ingredients thoroughly and frost the cake when it has cooled.
Hope you enjoy it!  It's easy to make and really tasty.  Good for birthday parties too!  Maybe you can talk Jeff into making one for you when you get back!  Love, Sam

ingred.name: raisins (I usually add a few more 1/2 cup)

text: Heat milk and pour over sugar and margarine.  When lukewarm add the yeast cake which has been disolved in 1/3 cup warm water.  Add the well beaten eggs, then add flour, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Add raisins last.
Turn out on board, let raise in warm place.  Kneed down, let raise again, pat in pans.  Let raise then bake mod. oven
Rasins good!  Dates better!!
Preheat oven to 350
Whisk together the yogurt, egg, molasses and butter.
In a seperate bowl, mix together the flour, bran, sugar, salt and baking soda.
Combine the dry and the liquid ingredients, stirring very gently until the dry ingredients are absorbed.  Never mind the lumps.
Add the chopped nuts.
Fill greased muffin pans 2/3 full, and bake for 30 minuntes.
Serve piping hot with butter and honey.  Bran muffins go well with coffee, yogurt and a steaming hot cup of coffee.
Test for readiness but inserting a wooden toothpick in the middle of a muffin.  If it comes out dry, the muffins are done.
Notes :  Do Not Overcook!
12 in pan + 8 silicon on 2nd tray
Cook - heat to 350 (set at 375 convection) - 20 mins for smaller silicon ones + 25 for pan

Pastry:  In large bowl, whisk flour with salt.  Using pastry blender, cut in butter and lard until in fine crumbs with a few larger pieces.  In liquid measure, whisk water with sour cream.  Drizzle over flour mixture, tossing briskly with fork and adding a little more water if necessary, until ragged dough forms.  Divide in half; press into 2 disks.  Wrap; refrigerate until chilled, 30 minutes.  (Make ahead: Refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze in airtight container for up to 1 month)

Peel and core apples; cut into 1/4 inch (5mm) thick slices to make 8 cups (2 L).  Place in large bowl.  In small bowl, toss together sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt; add to apples and toss until coated.
On lightly floured surface, roll out half of the pastry to generous 1/8 inch (3mm) thickness; fit into pie plate.  Trim to rim of pie plate.  Scrape in filling; dot with butter.

Roll out remaining pastry.  Whisk egg yolk with 1 tbsp water; brush some of this egg wash over pastry on rim.  Fit pastry over filling; trim to leave 3/4 inch (2 cm) overhang.  Fold upper layer of pastry under pastry on rim; flute to seal.  Brush some of the remaining egg wash lightly over pastry.  Cut steam vents in top; sprinkle with coarse sugar.

Bake in bottom third of 450 degree oven for 10 minutes.  Reduce heat to 350; bake until bottom is deep golden, apples are tender and filling is bubbly and thickened, about 65 minutes.  Let cool on rack.  (Make ahead: Set aside at room temperature for up to 8 hours)
Pre-heat oven to 425.
Beat eggs together and 1/2 cup sugar.  Add flour, salt, milk and vanilla and 1 tbsp butter.  Process until smooth, allow mixture to sit for 30 minutes while marinating plums.
Halve plums and remove pits.  If plums are large, cut in quarters.
Toss with remaining 2 tbsp sugar and pour over brandy.  Marinate for 30 minutes.
Brush an 8 or 9" skillet with remaining 1 tbsp butter.  Lay plums cut side down in dish, pressing them close together.  Whisk egg mixture and pour over plums.

Bake for about 15 minutes, lower heat to 375 and bake for 15-20 minutes longer or until slighly puffed but still wiggly in the centre.  Sprinkle with icing sugar just before serving.  Serve warm, serves 4-6.
Cook together until it tastes good!

In a large skillet, heat olive oil on medium high heat.  Add the onion and saute until soft, about 3 to 4 minutes.  Add the beef and cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until meat is well browned.  Add the garlic and reduce heat to medium low and cook for 2 minutes to soften garlic.

Deglaze the pan with the red wine and add the herbs, spices and tomatoes.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, 40 to 45 minutes or until sauce is thickened.  Adjust seasoning.  Set aside 1/2 cup sauce for the bechamel.

Cook pasta in a large pot of rolling boiling salt water for about 8 to 9 minutes or until al dente.  Drain pasta and toss it with the meat sauce in a large bowl.  Add the 2 beaten eggs and toss well to combine.  Reserve.

Bechamel:  Melt butter in a large heavy-bottomed pot on medium heat.  Add the flour and whisk to combine.  Cook for 2 minutes or until smooth.  Remove pot from heat and add cold milk in very small batches whisking each time until smooth.  Return to heat an whisk constantly on medium heat until mixture boils and thickens, about 4 to 5 minutes.  Season the bechamel with salt, pepper and nutmeg.
Remove from heat and gradually whisk in beaten eggs stirring briskly.  Stir in grated parmesan and the reserved 1/2 cup meat sauce.
Assembly:  Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Oil a 13x9x3" deep baking dish.  Top with pasta mixture.  Cover with bechamel.  Bake until top is golden brown and set, about 1 hour.  Let stand about 15 minutes before serving.
Preheat oven to 350
Line cookie sheets with parchment paper.
Melt butter and chocolate in a heavy pot over low heat, stirring until smooth.  Remove from heat and cool slightly.

Combine flour, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl.  Beat together eggs, sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until combined.  Blend chocolate mixture with egg mixture and then fold in flour mixture.

Place dough on cookie sheets in approximately 1 tbsp mounds, about 2" apart.  Bake for 9 to 10 minutes, leaving them slightly underbaked for a chewy, brownie-like texture.  Makes about 24 cookies.  Lucy Waverman
Serves 6 - that depends

Soak gelatin in cold water about 4 to 5 minutes.  Add 1/2 cup white sugar and softened gelatin to boiling water.  Stir till dissolved.  Add dash of salt, grated lemon rind and juice.  Let chill until mixture begins to set. (To speed up this phase I put it in the freezer and watch it).  Stiffly beat egg whites, add 1/4 cup sugar.  Beat again until stiff peaks form.  Fold into chilled lemon mixture.  (This can be done with beater or whisk).  Let set and serve with custard sauce.

Custard sauce: Scald milk.  Beat egg yolks, sugar and salt.  Stir into milk, cook in double boilier until mixture coats spoon and add vanilla.  (Steve used our double boilier to make his own version of wax for his woodturning so I actually use the microwave, and there is probably a custard recipe for your machine.  I scald the milk - high about 3 to 4 minutes till bubbly around the edge.  Beat egg yolks, sugar, salt, vanilla and gradually whisk in milk.  Then heat 2 minutes at medium and 2 to 4 more at low.  I stir every minute or so.  In my new microwave I tried 4 minutes at med low when you folks were here.  Too bad I wouldn't make it the same way twice!).
Serve cold on top of snow pudding.
Simmer over Bain-Marie (double boiler)
Drizzle beside hard cheeses, marinate chicken breasts or decorate plates.
Combine pomegranate juice, balsamic and honey.  Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook gently until it reduces down into a syrup that coats the back of a spoon (about 10 minutes).
Cool.  If it is too thick, add a little more pomegranate juice to thin it out.  Place in a squeeze bottle (even if you are giving it away).  Makes about 3/4 cup.  Lucy Waverman
Melt 125g butter and chocolate in the microwave.
Add sugar and eggs and flour.
Pour into 4 buttered ramekins
10 minutes in a hot oven
Combine and Presto!  (I hope.)

159.name: Pasta with Asparagus and Smoked Salmon

text: Simmer to thicken cream.
Boil pasta and asparagus together (5 minutes).
Toss cream with pasta, asparagus and salmon.
Cook pasta, combine other ingredients to make sauce. Put butter on pasta.  Combine together and garnish with cheese and parsley.
Remove stalks/stems from cherries, dust with firmly packed sugar and leave for 30 minutes.
Butter a baking tin and fill with cherries.
Add flour, salt, superfine sugar and well-beaten eggs.
Mix and add milk and mix again.
Pour over cherries and bake 350 for 35-40 minutes.
If using the oranges and strawberries, simmer for a few minutes.
Bring water and sugar to a boil in small saucepan, add remaining and simmer for 30 mins.  Remove lemons before serving.

ingred.name: uncooked Carnaroli, Arborio or medium-grain rice

text: Cook beans in boiling water 2 minutes.  Drain and rinse with cold water; drain.  Remove tough outer skins from beans; discard skins.  Cook peas in boiling water 2 minutes.  Drain and rinse with cold water; drain well.
Bring chicken stock to a simmer in a small saucepan (do not boil).  Keep warm over low heat.

Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat.  Add shallots and carrot to pan; cook 4 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.  Add rice and saffron; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Stir in wine; cook 30 seconds or until the liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly.  Add 1 cup stock; cook 4 minutes or until liquid is nearly absorbed, stirring constantly.  Add remaining stock, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly until each portion of stock is absorbed before adding the next (about 25 minutes total).  Stir in fava beans, peas and asparagus with last addition of stock.  Remove from heat; stir in cheese, parsley, salt and pepper.  Yield: 6 servings (serving size = 1 cup)

ingred.name: elbow macaroni, cooked and drained ( 8 oz )
pasteurized process cheese spread, cut into cubes (-shudder-)

text: Set power select at medium.  In a 3 quart casserole dish, combine macaroni, cheese, milk, salt, onion, mustard and pepper.  Heat, covered, 9 to 10 minutes; stirring twice.  Top with bread crumbs and heat, uncovered, 3 minutes.
Variation:  Use 1/2 cup tomato sauce for 1/4 cup milk and 1/8 tsp oregano for dry mustard.
Transcribers Note: If you ever make this meal for me as it is written I shall surely die.
I usually use a mixture of mashed potato and bread crumbs - whatever I have I suppose but at least 50:50.  I add milk or stock (chicken or vegetable) if I am cooking it in a casserole.
Saute onion in butter until tender in a large skillet or kettle.  Combine remaining ingredients and add to onion.  Heat well without browning, stirring frequently.
Yield: 5 to 6 cups.  Enough for neck and body cavity of a 10 to 12 lb turkey or two roasting chickens.
As usual, I don't really fallow this recipe but you get the idea! :) Mum
Doughboys: Cut butter into peas, make well in center, pour in milk.  Stir with knife.

Saute meat in oil, add onions, salt and pepper, summer savory and stir.  Add stock (water) and tomato juice; add ketchup (enough liquid to cover meat).  Add potatoes and carrots, let simmer 45 minutes.
Add Doughboys.  Don't lift cover while they cook.
In a large mixing bowl beat together for 2 minutes.  Put batter into greased and floured tube pan.  Bake at 375 for about 40 minutes.  Turn out on rack to cool and frost with your favourite icing.
Makes 24 large cupcakes.

ingred.name: canned diced plum (Roma) tomatoes, with juice
dried brown/pink lentils, picked over, rinsed and drained.

text: In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, warm the oil.  Add the onion, celery, carrot, garlic and bay leaf and saute until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.  Stir in the curry powder and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Add the tomatoes and their juice, lentils, stock and lemon slices.  Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat.  Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover partially, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the lentils are tender, about 30 minutes.  Discard the lemon slices and bay leaf.
Just before serving, stir in the spinach, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until the spinach is wilted but still bright green.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Ladle the soup into warmed bowls and serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 400.  Grease a 12 cup muffin tin, or line cups with paper muffin cups.

Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt in medium mixing bowl.  Combine eggs, milk and oil in small bowl.  Add liquids to dry ingredients, stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened.  Gently stir in blueberries and cranberries.  Fill muffin cups 2/3 full with batter.  Sprinkle muffins with remaining 2 tsp sugar.
Bake in 400 oven for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.  Remove muffins from pan; cool on wire rack.  Serve warm, makes 12 muffins.
Stir oats, sugar, coconut, baking powder and salt.
Stin in melted butter + vanilla
Spread in ungreased cake pan
Bake 300, 25 min
Blend all ingredients, set aside for 30 minutes in fridge, or overnight.  For more savory crepes, adjust salt and sugar, maybe vanilla.
Heat over medium heat until sugar melts and liquid reduces.
Add 1/4 lb butter softened; when sauce starts to tighten up, add crepes ont at a time, fold in quarters.  Serve with ice cream and a little sauce!
Rinse red lentils; discard any stones.
Heat oil in saucepan.  Add garlic and onion - cook until tender.  Add cumin, cook 30 seconds.  Add carrot and potato - cook 2-3 minutes.
Stir in lentils. Add liquid and bring to a boil.  Simmer 30-45 minutes.  Stir in lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle with cilantro

Mash the cheeses with a fork until no lumps are left.  Stir in the olive oil, eggs and seasonings combining everything thoroughly.  Spread a heaping tsp-full of the filling evently on 1/2 of a crepe and fold the other half over it.  Now take a slightly rounded tsp-full of filling and spread it on 1/2 of the surface of the folded crepe.  Fold the crepe again so it is folded in quarters.  Just before serving, sautee the folded crepes in butter, several minutes on each side.  Garnish with melon.

ingred.name: unsweetened cocoa powder + additional for sprinkling.

text: Preheat oven to 375 and butter an 8" round baking pan.
Line bottom with a round of waxpaper and butter paper.
In double boiler, melt chocolate with butter, stirring until smooth.
Remove top of double boiler, whisk sugar into chocolate mixture.  Add eggs and whisk well.
Sift 1/2 cup cocoa powder over chocolate mix, whisk until just combined.  Pour batter into pan and bake in middle oven 25 minutes until top has formed a thin crust.
Cool cake in pan on rack for 5 minutes.  Invert onto serving plate, dust with cocoa powder.

ingred.name: pineapples (not in recipe but I like them)

text: Sauce can be created in a saucepan.  Meatballs should be made first, assembled into 1-2" balls, preheat the oven to 350 and cook for 30 minutes or until they are no longer pink on the inside.  Christine Methven.
Stir
Mix together and serve, hopefully!

ingred.name: granny smith apples, peeled and diced

text: Sautee the scallions, celery and apples in the oil until tender.  Let cool.
Place the ground turkey in a large mixing bowl, add sauteed items and remaining ingredients.  Shape into eight 8oz burgers; refrigerate 2 hrs.
Season burgers with salt and pepper, place on pre-heated lightly oiled grill.  Grill each side 7 minutes until meat is thoroughly cooked.  Let sit five minutes.
Serve with a side of pear chutney and your favourite toasted bread, pita or roll.  (Oprah.com)
In a large bowl, beat eggs and sugar at max speed for five minutes.  Using a whisk, gently stir in yoghurt and vanilla.  Sift flour over mixture little by little, whisking to avoid lumps.
Delicately fold in berries.  Pour into 9" greased floured springform pan.  Sprinkle almonds over top.
Bake at 350 until top is evenly golden brown. (About 75 to 90 minutes)
Chill; remove form and serve.  Can drizzle with coulis or sauce when serving.

148.name: Chicken, Avocado, Herb Mayonnaise and Iceberg Lettuce

text: Preheat grill to high.  Combine olive oil and mustard and rub onto chicken thighs.  Season chicken with salt and pepper and grill for three to five minutes a side, or until cooked through.
Set aside to cool.  Fry pancetta slices in a skillet over medium low heat until crisp, about five minutes.  Drain on paper towels.

Combine basil, mint, parsley, green onions, arugula, lemon juice, 1/2 an avocado and mayonnaise in a food processor.  Season well with salt and pepper.  To store, press plastic wrap into the surface to keep it from discolouring.
Thickly slice chicken.  Peel and slie remaining avocados.  Cut baguette into four lengths, and slice each section in half lengthwise.

Toast bread if desired.  Spread herb mayonnaise on both sides of each baguette.  Cover bottom side with iceberg lettuce, chicken, avocado and one slice of pancetta.  Press the top half down firmly on top.  Serves 4.  Lucy Waverman.
Pat chicken dry inside and out.  Sprinkle cavity with salt and pepper to taste; insert orange quarters.  Tuck wing tips behind back and tie legs together with string.

Pat mustard over chicken.  Combine jam with soy sauce; brush over chicken.  Place breast side down on rack or inverted saucer in greased 11x7" baking dish.  Cover with waxed paper and microwave on high for 10 minutes.  Turn chicken over; baste with pan juices.  Microwave at medium (50%) for 20 to 30 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with fork, basting and rotating dish twice.  Transfer to serving platter; cover and let stand for 10 minutes.

Strain pan juices in 2 cup measure; skim off fat.  Blend water with cornstarch; stir into juices.  Microwave at high for 1 to 2 minutes or until thickened and smooth, stirring twice.  Makes 4 servings.

sources: The one and only Nicholas Leon Zwerling
